# ElizaOS Weekly Newsletter
### Week of November 8-14, 2025

## Executive Summary

This week at ElizaOS, we've reached several important milestones:
- **Token Migration Initiated**: The much-anticipated AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration launched with a 1:6 conversion ratio, following the November 11th snapshot.
- **Major Database Support Expansion**: Our framework now officially supports MySQL alongside PostgreSQL, significantly broadening deployment options.
- **GitHub Activity Surge**: The development team showed remarkable productivity with 4 new pull requests, 3 new issues, and contributions from 7 active developers in just the last 24 hours.

## Development Updates

### Core Improvements
- The team has completed entity isolation functionality for websocket and API, providing better separation between different agent environments
- PR #6143 adding MySQL support has been opened by @odilitime, enabling teams to use ElizaOS with either MySQL or PostgreSQL databases
- PR #6146 resolving TypeScript declaration generation errors has been merged, fixing critical build issues for developers
- A build error related to schema constraints was fixed, with "topP" being added as a required type

### Plugin Ecosystem
- The Anthropic plugin is being updated to support Claude 3.5 models, expanding our LLM options
- A new plugin submission for Coin Railz x402 Micropayment Services has been proposed (Issue #6148), potentially adding micropayment capabilities
- Issue #6145 highlighted the need to migrate from Langchain v0.3 to either langchain-classic or v1, preventing future compatibility problems

### Technical Debt & Performance
- Stan is nearing completion of entity isolation for websocket and API, expected to be finished within 1-2 days
- GitHub runner performance issues for the Babylon project were identified, with plans to implement a local runner solution for faster development

## Community Spotlight

The Discord community has been particularly active in helping each other navigate the token migration process:

- TobyMoonWalker supported multiple users with wallet migration, particularly those using Axiom wallet, by providing step-by-step guidance
- CryptoBlock🧩 helped explain Solscan verification for users uncertain about their token transfers
- Bertram created detailed instructions for users experiencing "max amount reached" errors during migration

Korean users have formed a supportive sub-community as they work through migration challenges with Bithumb, with team member Kenk confirming ongoing communications with the exchange.

## Token Economics

### Migration Status
- The AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration is in full swing following the November 11 snapshot at 11:40 UTC
- Migration ratio is confirmed at 1:6 (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS tokens)
- The migration period will last 90 days, after which manual exceptions may be made in extreme cases
- Cross-chain bridging functionality exists to move ElizaOS tokens across Solana, ETH, BASE & BSC chains

### Exchange Status
- Gate.io trading with ElizaOS has begun
- Bybit listing occurred on November 12
- The team is actively working with Bithumb, Binance, and Kraken to facilitate migration for CEX users
- Users with tokens in liquidity pools during the snapshot can file support tickets for manual migration

### Technical Implementation
- The ELIZA token is mintable on Dexscreener because Chainlink CCIP requires this functionality for cross-chain deployment
- A whitelist system was implemented to prevent arbitrage that was suppressing ElizaOS price

## Coming Soon

- A rebuilt X-like platform with AI agents for prediction markets is being developed, with a demo planned for upcoming Devconnect event
- University partnerships are being explored, including with the UT Austin robotics department
- Team member Jin is working on a new AI TV show project
- ElizaOS will soon be listed on Aster DEX
- The team is developing a points/leaderboard system to enhance community engagement

## Resources

- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/elizaos/eliza
- **Migration Portal**: [ElizaOS Migration Portal](https://migration.elizaos.com)
- **Support Ticket System**: [ElizaOS Support](https://support.elizaos.com)
- **Discord Server**: [Join ElizaOS Community](https://discord.gg/elizaos)
- **Token Bridges**: [Cross-chain Bridge Documentation](https://docs.elizaos.com/bridge)

For those experiencing migration issues, please check the appropriate exchange announcements or open a support ticket. Response time may be up to 7 days due to high volume.

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-13

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration Issues
- A snapshot was taken on November 11 at 11:40 UTC for AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration
- Tokens purchased after the snapshot are not eligible for migration
- Many users, especially those on exchanges like Bithumb and Kraken, are experiencing migration difficulties
- Korean users are particularly affected as Bithumb has made no announcements about migration support
- The migration pool has reached its limit in some instances, causing "max amount reached" errors
- A ticket system has been established for handling individual migration issues, with response times up to 7 days
- Some community members have expressed concerns about the snapshot approach

### Technical Development
- The ELIZA token is mintable on Dexscreener because Chainlink CCIP requires this functionality for cross-chain deployment
- Odilitime explained that migration from token2022 was the primary goal rather than changing mintable status
- Several PRs are awaiting review, including #6143 in the main ElizaOS repository and #11 in the Anthropic plugin
- The Anthropic plugin needs updating to support Claude 3.5 models
- Stan is close to completing entity isolation functionality for websocket and API
- A build error related to dependencies and schema constraints was discussed, with "topP" needing to be added as a type

### Developer Tooling
- Developers discussed GitHub runner performance issues for the Babylon project
- Stan offered to share a way to run a local GitHub runner for improved performance
- Questions were raised about configuring debuggers with Bun and enabling breakpoints

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Is there a max amount of AI16Z that we can migrate to ElizaOS?**  
A: There is no max amount. (TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: I hold AI16Z on axiom wallet, how do I get ElizaOS token?**  
A: Transfer tokens from Axiom to Phantom wallet, then use the migration portal. (TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Will Bithumb support the AI16Z → ElizaOS migration?**  
A: The team is in communication with Bithumb, but exchange support is at their discretion. (Kenk)

**Q: Why can I not migrate? It says max amount reached. Is the bridge finished?**  
A: The migration pool has reached its current limit. Wait until the next migration window opens. (Bertram)

**Q: So if someone buys AI16Z today they won't be able to ever migrate?**  
A: Tokens bought after November 11 snapshot will not be eligible to migrate. (Alexei)

**Q: Is automatic migration on exchanges entirely at the discretion of the exchange?**  
A: Yes, it is at the discretion of the exchange, but the team has reached out to all exchanges. (Kenk)

**Q: How long does it take to get a reply after opening a ticket?**  
A: Up to 7 days. (Kenk)

**Q: Why on dexscreener it says elizaos is mintable?**  
A: Chainlink CCIP requires it, so we can mint onto the chains. (Odilitime)

**Q: How far are you with your PR?**  
A: Super near. I guess 1 or 2 fullday of work. (Stan ⚡)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Wallet Migration Support**
   - TobyMoonWalker helped Artty with transferring tokens from Axiom wallet to Phantom before using the migration portal
   - CryptoBlock🧩 explained to harouna how to use Solscan for verification and directed them to open a support ticket
   - Bertram provided step-by-step guidance to Nika who was having issues migrating from Phantom wallet

2. **Exchange Migration Information**
   - Toni shared Binance Wallet's announcement about migration support with user Full Ahead
   - Kenk confirmed to Korean users that the team is in contact with Bithumb and working on a solution

3. **Technical Troubleshooting**
   - When asher@CoinEx reported a non-functional migration link, vaipraonde confirmed it was working on their end
   - Stan completed code reviews for PRs #6146 and #6147 requested by 0xbbjoker
   - Stan offered to share a way to run a local GitHub runner with sayonara who was experiencing slow CI/CD

## Action Items

### Technical
- Resolve migration issues for users who transferred tokens from exchanges after the snapshot (Multiple users)
- Address the "max amount reached" error in the migration portal (Alexei)
- Complete verification process on Jupiter, Titan, and Moonshot (Toni)
- Establish process for handling Bithumb and Kraken users' migration (Kenk)
- Review PR #6143 in ElizaOS repository (Odilitime)
- Review PR #11 in plugin-anthropic repository (Odilitime)
- Update Anthropic plugin to support Claude 3.5 models (Odilitime)
- Add "topP" as a type in the core (0xbbjoker)
- Complete entity isolation for websocket and API (Stan ⚡)
- Fix issue mentioned by Odilitime (response to "Ugly, I'll fix") (Odilitime)
- Implement faster GitHub runner solution for Babylon (sayonara)
- Fix debugging setup with Bun to allow breakpoints (vaipraonde)
- Implement functionality to store and retrieve shared numbers between agents (vaipraonde)

### Documentation
- Create clear guidance for users with tokens on exchanges that haven't supported migration (Multiple users)
- Provide step-by-step instructions for migration from different wallet types (Nika)
- Update documentation on how to create and search memories for the new version (vaipraonde)

### Feature
- Consider reopening migration without snapshot restrictions (Omid sa)
- Implement solution for users who had tokens in liquidity pools during snapshot (uzo)
- List ElizaOS on Aster DEX (iory yagamy)
- Improve communication channels for Korean community beyond Discord and X (kk)
- Consider alternatives to Twitter API integration due to cost concerns (vaipraonde)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-12

**Date: November 12, 2025**

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- A snapshot was taken on November 11, 2023, at 11:40 UTC to determine eligibility for AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration
- Migration ratio is 1:6 (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS)
- Whitelist system implemented to prevent arbitrage that was suppressing ElizaOS price
- Migration period will last 90 days
- Team is working with exchanges (Bithumb, Binance, Kraken) to facilitate migration for CEX users
- Users with tokens in liquidity pools during snapshot need to file support tickets for manual migration

### Technical Development
- Team is developing a rebuilt X-like platform with AI agents for prediction markets
- Demo planned for upcoming Devconnect event
- Some users reported issues with X posts from agents using elizaOS not working properly
- Discussion about Vector DB options for onchain data, focusing on transparency and verifiability of embeddings

### Partnerships & Projects
- Potential university partnerships with UT Austin robotics department mentioned
- Team member Jin is working on a new AI TV show project

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: When was the snapshot taken?**  
A: The snapshot was taken at 11:40 UTC on November 11, 2023 (answered by shaw)

**Q: What is the conversion ratio from AI16Z to ElizaOS?**  
A: 1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: What happens to AI16Z tokens held on exchanges?**  
A: The team is working with exchanges to handle migration, and if exchanges don't support it, users can file tickets for manual migration (answered by shaw)

**Q: What happens to AI16Z tokens in liquidity pools during the snapshot?**  
A: Users should file a support ticket as the snapshot likely didn't capture LP positions (answered by DorianD)

**Q: Can I still buy AI16Z and migrate it?**  
A: No, only tokens held at the time of the snapshot are eligible (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: What happens to AI16Z tokens that don't get migrated within 90 days?**  
A: They will remain as AI16Z tokens, with possible manual migration in extreme cases (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: Why was a whitelist implemented for migration?**  
A: To prevent arbitrage which was keeping the AI16Z price pegged and depressing ElizaOS price (answered by shaw)

**Q: How long will the migration be available?**  
A: 90 days (answered by shaw)

**Q: Why was this snapshot made and who are you trying to restrict from converting?**  
A: It was done to get price unpegged from AI16Z so it could pump (answered by shaw)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Migration Issues with Exchange-Held Tokens**
   - User: susu
   - Helper: shaw
   - Issue: Concerns about AI16Z tokens held on Bithumb exchange
   - Resolution: Shaw confirmed they're working with Bithumb and will manually migrate tokens if needed

2. **Post-Snapshot Token Purchase**
   - User: Omid sa
   - Helper: shaw
   - Issue: User bought tokens before announcement but after snapshot
   - Resolution: Shaw directed user to file a ticket for manual assistance

3. **LP Token Migration**
   - User: FunkyLiza
   - Helper: DorianD
   - Issue: User had AI16Z tokens in liquidity pool during snapshot
   - Resolution: Suggested filing a support ticket as snapshot likely didn't capture LP positions

4. **Migration Error Troubleshooting**
   - User: DorianD
   - Helper: shaw & ben
   - Issue: Encountered a simulation failure error when trying to migrate tokens
   - Resolution: Issue resolved when DorianD removed decimal places from transaction amount; ben forwarded additional context to the development team

5. **Migration Tool Access**
   - User: Goated
   - Helper: Toni
   - Issue: User needed migration tool link
   - Resolution: Provided link to migration announcement

## Action Items

### Technical
- **Implement manual migration process** for users with legitimate holdings not captured in snapshot (Mentioned by shaw)
- **Complete integration with exchanges** for token migration with Bithumb, Kraken and other exchanges (Mentioned by shaw)
- **Showcase rebuilt X platform** with AI agents for prediction markets at Devconnect (Mentioned by shaw)
- **Investigate simulation failure errors** during migration when using decimal amounts (Mentioned by DorianD)
- **Process support tickets** for migration issues with priority (Mentioned by Kenk)
- **Investigate X post issues** from agents using elizaOS while custom Python agents work correctly (Mentioned by JD_soul🇨🇻)
- **Fix wallet balance display issue** when clicking "Max" button (Mentioned by Jesse Spencer)
- **Restore X (Twitter) accounts** before EFDevcon (Mentioned by DannyNOR NoFapArc)
- **Implement cross-chain functionality** for ElizaOS across SOL, ETH, BASE & BSC chains (Mentioned by CryptoBlock)

### Documentation
- **Create clear guidelines** about migration eligibility explaining snapshot criteria and whitelist system (Mentioned by Cryptologos)
- **Update migration FAQ** with common issues and solutions addressing "Max Amount Reached" errors and LP token migration (Mentioned by bramblebeard)
- **Create documentation** about avoiding scammers in the community (Mentioned by Stanislav Tiutiunnyk)

### Feature
- **Develop prediction markets with AI agents** as training ground for improving prediction capabilities (Mentioned by shaw)
- **Explore solutions for transparency/verifiability** of embeddings in Vector DBs for onchain data (Mentioned by Victor)
- **Consider university partnerships** with University of Texas robotics researchers (Mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-11

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- Migration from AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens is in full swing
- A snapshot is scheduled for November 11, 2023, at 11:40 UTC, after which no new AI16Z purchases can be migrated
- Users reported technical issues with the migration portal, including "max amount reached" errors
- Cross-chain bridging functionality exists to move ElizaOS tokens from Solana to Base network
- Some users experiencing difficulties with wallet connectivity during migration process

### Exchange Listings & Tokenomics
- Gate.io trading starting soon with ElizaOS
- Bybit listing mentioned for November 12
- The token has a large supply (11B) which some users questioned
- No single-sided staking is currently available, but liquidity providing (LP) is an option

### Development Updates
- ElizaOS is an open-source project hosted on GitHub (https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) where anyone can contribute
- R0am deployed an OTC agent to Vercel with database assistance from cjft
- Discussion about Eleven Labs' Scribe v2 API with Voice Activity Detection capabilities
- Technical issue raised regarding EventType.MESSAGE_RECEIVED being removed from bootstrap
- Successful plugin conversion to use service approach rather than relying on removed event type

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can I contribute to this framework?** (Momotaro)  
A: "It's open source, anyone can work on it" (Odilitime)

**Q: Are there any plans for elizaos to enter the cex spot market?** (Noryfy)  
A: "ElizaOS listed tomorrow in Gate io" (bct)

**Q: Any plan for this huge supply?** (iory yagamy)  
A: "It just felt right" (Kenk)

**Q: Is there any staking for ElizaOS?** (WatermelonSugar)  
A: "You can LP, no single sided staking atm" (Kenk)

**Q: How can I convert AI16Z tokens in Trust Wallet to ElizaOS?** (Jesse Spencer)  
A: "You'll have to move your tokens to one of the supported wallets to do the migration" (Borko)

**Q: EventType.MESSAGE_RECEIVED was removed from bootstrap but I think we need it back** (Odilitime)  
A: "We do not use it for message handling anymore, but it can be usefull for other plugin to listen it, true." (Stan ⚡)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Migration Support**
   - Kenk helped ole with bridging elizaOS from Solana to Base, suggesting creating a support ticket and manually adding the Base contract address to wallet
   - Omid sa clarified migration timeline and snapshot details for wuming
   - Borko suggested typing in the exact amount instead of using "max" button to resolve migration errors

2. **Development Assistance**
   - cjft provided R0am with Neon database credentials for OTC agent deployment
   - Stan ⚡ helped Odilitime understand current usage patterns for event handling, leading to successful plugin conversion

3. **Technical Guidance**
   - Borko advised Jesse Spencer to move AI16Z tokens to supported wallets for migration
   - Odilitime provided GitHub link and confirmed anyone can work on the ElizaOS framework

## Action Items

### Technical
- Fix the "max amount reached" error in the migration portal (Rocket Hamster)
- Resolve bridging issues from Solana to Base (ole)
- Add PostgreSQL database to OTC agent deployment (R0am)
- Convert plugin to use service instead of EventType.MESSAGE_RECEIVED (Odilitime)
- Resolve issue with reading FID from env file when using Farcaster plugin with Eliza (Pr⭕f. J)

### Documentation
- Create clear migration instructions for Coinbase wallet users (terrapin)
- Update and align communication across platforms regarding snapshot timing (wuming)
- Document Voice Activity Detection features in Eleven Labs Scribe v2 API (cjft)

### Feature
- Implement single-sided staking for ElizaOS (WatermelonSugar)
- Address concerns about token supply size (iory yagamy)
- Create or provide a 3D model of Eliza for use as referee/validator agent in neural fight games (Amir)

# Analysis of Discord Chat in 💬-discussion Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily revolves around migration issues from AI16Z to ElizaOS tokens. A snapshot was taken on November 11 at 11:40 UTC, after which tokens purchased would not be eligible for migration. Many users, particularly those holding tokens on exchanges like Bithumb and Kraken, are experiencing difficulties with migration. Korean users are especially affected as Bithumb has not made any announcements regarding migration support. The team has confirmed they're working with exchanges but emphasized that automatic migration is at the discretion of each exchange. Users who transferred tokens from exchanges to personal wallets after the snapshot are finding they cannot migrate. The team has established a ticket system for handling individual migration issues, with response times up to 7 days. Some community members have expressed concerns about the snapshot approach, suggesting it disrupts the natural arbitrage process that was helping both tokens.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there a max amount of AI16Z that we can migrate to ElizaOS? (asked by Parv) A: There is no max amount. (answered by TobyMoonWalker)
Q: Why have we been falling so much since yesterday? (asked by Jota | Prime Bunny) A: The team disputed this characterization, noting the token has been rising from 0.0082 to 0.01011. (answered by TobyMoonWalker)
Q: I hold AI16Z on axiom wallet, how do I get ElizaOS token? (asked by Artty) A: Transfer tokens from Axiom to Phantom wallet, then use the migration portal. (answered by TobyMoonWalker)
Q: Will Bithumb support the AI16Z → ElizaOS migration? (asked by 올타는 어려워) A: The team is in communication with Bithumb, but exchange support is at their discretion. (answered by Kenk)
Q: Why can I not migrate? It says max amount reached. Is the bridge finished? (asked by Alexei) A: The migration pool has reached its current limit. Wait until the next migration window opens. (answered by Bertram)
Q: So if someone buys AI16Z today they won't be able to ever migrate? (asked by Alexei) A: Tokens bought after November 11 snapshot will not be eligible to migrate. (answered by Alexei)
Q: When is the next snapshot? (asked by harouna) A: No new snapshot is planned. (answered by Alexei)
Q: Is automatic migration on exchanges entirely at the discretion of the exchange? (asked by kk) A: Yes, it is at the discretion of the exchange, but the team has reached out to all exchanges. (answered by Kenk)
Q: How long does it take to get a reply after opening a ticket? (asked by Parv) A: Up to 7 days. (answered by Kenk)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Kenk | Helpee: kk | Context: Korean users on Bithumb unable to migrate | Resolution: Confirmed team is in contact with Bithumb and working on a solution

Documentation: Create clear guidance for users with tokens on exchanges that haven't supported migration | Mentioned By: Multiple users

# Discord Chat Analysis for 🥇-partners

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The main technical point addressed was about ELIZA token's mintable status on Dexscreener. Odilitime explained that this mintability is required for Chainlink CCIP functionality to enable cross-chain deployment. They clarified that migrating away from token2022 was the primary goal of a recent migration, rather than changing the mintable status. The conversation briefly touched on $TAO and its upcoming halving event, though without technical depth. There were no major decisions, problem-solving activities, or implementations discussed in this brief chat segment.

## 2. FAQ

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-13

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration Issues
- A snapshot was taken on November 11 at 11:40 UTC for AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration
- Tokens purchased after the snapshot are not eligible for migration
- Many users, especially those on exchanges like Bithumb and Kraken, are experiencing migration difficulties
- Korean users are particularly affected as Bithumb has made no announcements about migration support
- The migration pool has reached its limit in some instances, causing "max amount reached" errors
- A ticket system has been established for handling individual migration issues, with response times up to 7 days
- Some community members have expressed concerns about the snapshot approach

### Technical Development
- The ELIZA token is mintable on Dexscreener because Chainlink CCIP requires this functionality for cross-chain deployment
- Odilitime explained that migration from token2022 was the primary goal rather than changing mintable status
- Several PRs are awaiting review, including #6143 in the main ElizaOS repository and #11 in the Anthropic plugin
- The Anthropic plugin needs updating to support Claude 3.5 models
- Stan is close to completing entity isolation functionality for websocket and API
- A build error related to dependencies and schema constraints was discussed, with "topP" needing to be added as a type

### Developer Tooling
- Developers discussed GitHub runner performance issues for the Babylon project
- Stan offered to share a way to run a local GitHub runner for improved performance
- Questions were raised about configuring debuggers with Bun and enabling breakpoints

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Is there a max amount of AI16Z that we can migrate to ElizaOS?**  
A: There is no max amount. (TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: I hold AI16Z on axiom wallet, how do I get ElizaOS token?**  
A: Transfer tokens from Axiom to Phantom wallet, then use the migration portal. (TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Will Bithumb support the AI16Z → ElizaOS migration?**  
A: The team is in communication with Bithumb, but exchange support is at their discretion. (Kenk)

**Q: Why can I not migrate? It says max amount reached. Is the bridge finished?**  
A: The migration pool has reached its current limit. Wait until the next migration window opens. (Bertram)

**Q: So if someone buys AI16Z today they won't be able to ever migrate?**  
A: Tokens bought after November 11 snapshot will not be eligible to migrate. (Alexei)

**Q: Is automatic migration on exchanges entirely at the discretion of the exchange?**  
A: Yes, it is at the discretion of the exchange, but the team has reached out to all exchanges. (Kenk)

**Q: How long does it take to get a reply after opening a ticket?**  
A: Up to 7 days. (Kenk)

**Q: Why on dexscreener it says elizaos is mintable?**  
A: Chainlink CCIP requires it, so we can mint onto the chains. (Odilitime)

**Q: How far are you with your PR?**  
A: Super near. I guess 1 or 2 fullday of work. (Stan ⚡)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Wallet Migration Support**
   - TobyMoonWalker helped Artty with transferring tokens from Axiom wallet to Phantom before using the migration portal
   - CryptoBlock🧩 explained to harouna how to use Solscan for verification and directed them to open a support ticket
   - Bertram provided step-by-step guidance to Nika who was having issues migrating from Phantom wallet

2. **Exchange Migration Information**
   - Toni shared Binance Wallet's announcement about migration support with user Full Ahead
   - Kenk confirmed to Korean users that the team is in contact with Bithumb and working on a solution

3. **Technical Troubleshooting**
   - When asher@CoinEx reported a non-functional migration link, vaipraonde confirmed it was working on their end
   - Stan completed code reviews for PRs #6146 and #6147 requested by 0xbbjoker
   - Stan offered to share a way to run a local GitHub runner with sayonara who was experiencing slow CI/CD

## Action Items

- Resolve migration issues for users who transferred tokens from exchanges after the snapshot (Multiple users)
- Address the "max amount reached" error in the migration portal (Alexei)
- Complete verification process on Jupiter, Titan, and Moonshot (Toni)

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 9 - 15, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's development focused on strengthening the core stability and configuration of the ElizaOS framework. Key achievements include a critical fix for Row-Level Security (RLS) validation, ensuring correct user access when isolation is disabled. Significant progress was also made in standardizing agent configuration by resolving how environment variables are loaded. Concurrently, work began on enhancing the core runtime to support a unified messaging API, reflecting a continued effort to build a robust and scalable foundation for AI agents.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this week centered on bug fixes, core enhancements, and new tooling capabilities.

- **Core Stability and Configuration Fixes**
    - A crucial bug was fixed where environment variables were not being loaded correctly, preventing agents from accessing settings. The system now properly loads variables from `process.env` instead of relying solely on `.env` files ([#6141](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6141)).
    - A critical issue with Row-Level Security (RLS) was resolved. The fix prevents `server_id` validation from incorrectly blocking all users when RLS isolation is disabled ([#6139](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6139)).
    - To improve system stability, a pull request was opened to remove message emission in the `src` API, aiming to prevent potential race conditions ([#6137](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6137)).

- **Runtime and API Enhancements**
    - A new feature was merged to include an ElizaOS reference within the runtime. This change is a step towards creating a unified messaging API and involved updates across several core packages ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

- **New Tooling Features**
    - A new pull request was opened to add an OpenRouter embedding option to the command-line interface (CLI), expanding the framework's integration capabilities ([#6142](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6142)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage

- **Closed Issues:**
    - Issue [#6138](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6138), which reported that disabling the Web UI blocked all endpoints, was opened and closed on the same day. It was noted as being prematurely opened and remains under investigation.

- **New & Active Issues:**
    - A new high-priority issue was reported where an agent fails to respond to questions, producing a "No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_LARGE" error ([#6140](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6140)). This represents a potential blocker for agent communication functionality.
    - No active issues generated significant discussion this week.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The development activity this week indicates a focused effort on foundational improvements. The work on environment variables, RLS, and race conditions suggests a proactive approach to ensuring system stability and reliability. While the reports do not indicate high levels of discussion on specific issues, the mix of bug fixes, core refactoring, and new feature proposals demonstrates steady and methodical progress across the project.

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.
